metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2881 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The underlying bug might cause read past end of the buffer and either read memory it should not read, or crash the process.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2881` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.17
bind9-host - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.17
bind9utils - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.17
dnsutils - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.17
libbind9-160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.17
libdns-export1100 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.17
libdns1100 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.17
libirs-export160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.17
libirs160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.17
libisc-export169 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.17
libisc169 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.17
libisccc-export160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.17
libisccc160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.17
libisccfg-export160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.17
libisccfg160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.17
liblwres160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.17
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: alexmurray> As of isc-dhcp-4.4.3-1, isc-dhcp vendors bind9 libs mdeslaur> affects 9.18+

criterions.comment: bind9 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.17').
